metadata.Title: CVE-2015-2155 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The force printer in tcpdump before 4.7.2 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) and possibly execute arbitrary code via unspecified vectors.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-2155` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

tcpdump - 4.5.1-2ubuntu1.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: tcpdump package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.5.1-2ubuntu1.2').
